section.heading: Prohibition on Fantasy Competition Play.
section.text: Participation in a fantasy competition for which there is an entry fee is prohibited for:

para.text: A minor, who is an individual under the age of 18;
A Commission member;
An officer or an employee of the Agency;
An individual who lives in the same principal residence as a Commission member or an officer or employee of the Agency and is the member’s, officer’s, or employee’s:
Spouse or domestic partner;
Child;
Sibling; or
Parent or parent-in-law; or
An individual who has asked to be excluded under COMAR 36.09.05.

section.heading: Prohibition on Fantasy Competition Kiosks.
section.text: Fantasy competitions may not be offered through a kiosk or machine physically located in the State.

section.heading: Restrictions on Fantasy Competition Play by Individuals Associated with Operators.

para.text: Except as provided in §B of this regulation an employee, principal, officer, director, or contractor of a fantasy competition operator, or a member of that individual’s immediate family, is prohibited from participating in a fantasy competition offered by any fantasy competition operator; and
Exception. An individual associated with a fantasy competition operator may participate in a fantasy competition only if:
Participation is for testing purposes and:
The individual uses a clearly marked test account for testing purposes including evaluating a fantasy competition platform;
The individual fully discloses affiliation with a fantasy competition operator to each fantasy competition player in the fantasy competition;
The individual is not eligible to win a prize; and
The individual awards any prize won in a fantasy competition to the participant who would have won the prize if the individual associated with a fantasy competition operator had not participated; or
The fantasy competition is a private fantasy competition that is:
Clearly marked as a private fantasy competition;
Limited by the fantasy competition operator to:
Employees of the fantasy competition operator;
Immediate family members of an employee of the fantasy competition operator; and
Friends of an employee of a fantasy competition operator; and
Contains a prominently displayed statement informing players that the fantasy competition may include players with specialized knowledge and expertise that could affect their odds of winning.

section.heading: Prohibition on Fantasy Competition Play by Athletes and Others.

para.text: An athlete, sports agent, team employee, referee, or league official, or a member of that individual’s immediate family, is prohibited from entering fantasy competitions based on underlying sporting events in which the individual is a participant.

An athlete, sports agent, team employee, referee, or league official, or a member of that individual’s immediate family, may not enter fantasy competitions based on underlying sporting events in which the individual is a participant through another person as a proxy.

section.heading: Ensuring Fair Outcomes in Fantasy Competitions.

para.text: Fantasy Competition Scripts.

A fantasy competition operator may not permit the use of unauthorized scripts on a fantasy competition platform and shall use commercially reasonable efforts to monitor for and prevent use of such scripts.
For the purpose of §A(1) of this regulation, scripts shall be treated as offering a competitive advantage if potential uses include:
Facilitating changes in many line ups at one time;
Facilitating use of commercial products designed and distributed by third parties to identify advantageous game strategies;
Submitting entry fees or adjusting the athletes selected by a fantasy competition player; or
Gathering information about the performance of others for the purpose of identifying or entering competitions against fantasy competition players who are less likely to be successful.
Authorized scripts shall either be incorporated as a game feature or be prominently displayed and thereby made available to all fantasy competition players.
Beginner Games and Identification of Highly Experienced Players.
Fantasy competition operators shall offer some fantasy competitions that are limited to beginner players and exclude highly experienced players.

Fantasy competition operators shall clearly and prominently display that a highly experienced player is participating in a fantasy competition by attaching a symbol to the username of a highly experienced player, or by other easily visible means.
Fantasy Competition Entries.
A fantasy competition operator shall disclose the number of entries a fantasy competition player may submit for each fantasy competition.
A fantasy operator shall take reasonable steps to prevent fantasy competition players from submitting more than the allowable number of entries.
Limit on Number of Accounts. A fantasy competition operator may not permit a player to establish more than one account with a fantasy competition operator.
Disputes. Fantasy competition operators shall provide an opportunity for fantasy competition players to file a player dispute.
Data. Fantasy competition operators shall prominently display the source of the data utilized in determining results.

section.heading: Prohibition on Fantasy Competitions Based on Amateur Sports.
section.text: A fantasy competition operator may not offer a fantasy competition based on a sporting event featuring amateur athletes who are primarily under 18 years old.

section.heading: Advertising.
section.text: Fantasy competition operator advertisements may not depict:

para.text: Minors, except professional athletes who may be minors;
Students;
Schools or colleges; or
School or college settings.
